title: Interfaces (C#)
text: An interface contains definitions for a group of related functionalities that a non-abstract class or a struct must implement. An interface may define static methods, which must have an implementation. Beginning with C# 8.0, an interface may define a default implementation for members. An interface may not declare instance data such as fields, auto-implemented properties, or property-like events.
